item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Cheap Thrills, an album cover by Robert Crumb (2020) (54 points | 12 comments)
2. The history of Unix's ioctl and signal about window sizes (34 points | discuss)
3. Scientists glue two proteins together, driving cancer cells to self-destruct (411 points | 106 comments)
4. Is the Q Source the Origin of the Gospels? (20 points | 1 comment)
5. The Saga of a Celebrated Scientist – and His Rodent Dystopia (11 points | 3 comments)
6. The Secret of Ramsey Numbers (9 points | 1 comment)
7. PropelAuth (YC W22) is hiring Fullstack and Rust engineers ( | hide)
8. An embarrassingly simple approach to recover unlearned knowledge for LLMs (158 points | 52 comments)
9. Project Sid: Many-agent simulations toward AI civilization (333 points | 98 comments)
10. Hertz-dev, the first open-source base model for conversational audio (185 points | 36 comments)
11. Scalable watermarking for identifying large language model outputs (8 points | discuss)
12. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (1014 points | 708 comments)
13. I've had a change of heart regarding employee metrics (300 points | 168 comments)
14. A Hamiltonian Circuit for Rubik's Cube (77 points | 21 comments)
15. pg_flo – Stream, transform, and re-route PostgreSQL data in real-time (189 points | 33 comments)
16. Open-source wheeled biped robot (25 points | 9 comments)
17. Ritonavir Form III: A Coincidental Concurrent Discovery (16 points | 4 comments)
18. The Submerged Nabataean Temple in Puteoli at Pozzuoli, Italy (51 points | 16 comments)
19. Programming languages that blew my mind (2023) (267 points | 148 comments)
20. PacCam: Pac-Man controlled with your face (40 points | 6 comments)
21. Interview gone wrong (108 points | 147 comments)
22. gptel: a simple LLM client for Emacs (131 points | 27 comments)
23. Top discoveries about ancient people from DNA in 2023 (69 points | 4 comments)
24. Ask HN: What would you preserve if the internet were to go down tomorrow? (180 points | 215 comments)
25. Show HN: Tinder, but to Decide What to Eat (169 points | 163 comments)
26. It's a Palworld After All a Lawyer Explains Nintendo vs. Palworld [video] (12 points | 2 comments)
27. Venvstacks: Virtual Environment Stacks for Python (108 points | 51 comments)
28. Missing open-source contributor presents a dilemma when accepting their PR (74 points | 50 comments)
29. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (225 points | 85 comments)
30. The performance of hashing for similar function detection (45 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
